verses.roman:
'viśvāsa' yāñā tāṅhāre sakala kahila
hindu-veśa dhari' sei yavana āila

synonyms: viśvāsa—the secretary; yāñā—returning; tāṅhāre—unto the Mohammedan governor; sakala kahila—told everything; hindu-veśa dhari'-accepting the dress of a Hindu; sei yavana—that Mohammedan governor; āila—came.
translation: The secretary returned to the Mohammedan governor and informed him of this news. Dressing himself like a Hindu, the Mohammedan governor then came to see Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu.
